content:
re :Tell me how to roll back from v128.3.1esr to a version without snaps -- without losing 10 years worth of email!

Snap stores everything in a different location. I'm not sure where your profile has been copied to at this point, but here is some info.

I believe snap wants to use this location for profile: /home/yourusername/snap/thunderbird/common/.thunderbird/xxxxxxxx.profileName

I believe flatpack uses this: .~/.var/app/org.mozilla.Thunderbird/.thunderbird/<profile name>

Default location for a Thunderbird profile when you download from official website. Linux and Unix Profile folders are located here: ~/.thunderbird<Profile name>/ However, if you're using a third party build from Debian or Ubuntu, those builds store your profile folder here: ~/.mozilla-thunderbird<Profile name>.

In all cases the folder you need to copy is '.thunderbird' (or maybe '.mozilla-thunderbird')


Info on installing Thunderbird.

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/installing-thunderbird-linux

Version 128.3.1esr https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/ Choose Locale: Language, Thunderbird Extended Support release, OS - Linux
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Prova a seguire queste operazioni di manutenzione del database (salta eventualmente quelle che hai già provato):

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

Se il problema non si risolve, bisogna ripristinare l'archivio a partire dall'ultimo backup funzionate di cui disponi.

Il problema è probabilmente una corruzione del database. Spesso è causata da un antivirus male configurato, da certi programmi per la pulizia del sistema operativo, da blackout improvvisi, da chiusure forzate dell'applicazione.
creator: @next

content:
You may be aware that recently Microsoft changed the Authentication Method when it comes to using third party email clients eg: Thunderbird.

I'm not sure whether you have already done the following but please check anyway.

Account Settings must use the following: Server Type: POP Mail Server

  • Server Name: outlook.office365.com
  • Port 995
  • User Name: xxxx@hotmail.com
  • Connection Security: SSL/LTS
  • Authentication Method: OAuth2


Server Type: IMAP Mail Server

  • Server Name: outlook.office365.com
  • Port 993
  • User Name: xxxx@hotmail.com
  • Connection Security: SSL/LTS
  • Authentication Method: OAuth2

SMTP:

  • Server Name: smtp.office365.com
  • Port: 587
  • Connection Security: STARTTLS
  • Authentication method: OAuth2
  • User Name: example@hotmail.com

Settings > Privacy & Security Check under Web Content -

  • Select: 'Accept cookies from sites'
  • Accept third party cookies' 'Always'
  • Click on 'Exceptions' button next to Accept cookies from sites to make sure you are not blocking cookies from Microsoft sites, such as :hotmail.com, outlook.com, office365.com, www.live.com, www.msn.com

If Thunderbird stored your hotmail password then it may be located here: Settings > Privacy & Security

  • Scroll down to 'Passwords' section
  • click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • Click on 'Show Passwords'

If you get a 'Windows security' prompt for a password.... When you start computer, you get asked to login to your User Account using a password to see desktop etc. It wants that password.

Then you can see the stored passwords.

However, it sounds like you are in a position where you need to check things by logging on to your microsoft account and/or hotmail account via a browser.

Your microsoft account and your hotmail account need to have the same password. Info at this link says:

  • https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/office/how-to-sign-in-to-hotmail-c378938b-c0eb-40c1-b99e-338dd9e776a8

Can't sign in to Hotmail or Outlook.com? Notes: Your Hotmail or Outlook.com password is the same as your Microsoft Account password.

So get that sorted first. If you found a password in Thunderbird saved passwords then I suggest you try using that first. If you did not find anything or forgotten - on the webpage where you login to webmail there will be a 'forgotten pasword' link which you need to use. Follow instructions to regain access to your webmail account. Once in the webmail account you can modifiy/update password.

In microsoft account If you have more email addresses or alias hotmail addresses etc When it comes to 'sending' - smtp in Thunderbird - it can only send using the 'primary' email address, so if you want to send using hotmail email address then make sure it is set up as the primary email address.

Once you have all these settings and got the password sorted.

Restart Thunderbird When you get the Microsoft pop up window asking for password, type it in and clickon 'Sign in'. You may then get another window asking to allow Thunderbird access to server - click on 'Accept'
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
All the code changed, so it's not surprising old code will not work in more recent versions.

As a heads up, you could use : Tools > Developer Tools > select 'Developer Toolbox' You will get a pop up window asking you to 'OK' connection - often it hides behind a window.

content:
Se ti riferisci alla password della casella di posta, devi rivolgerti a chi gestisce il server di posta di studioannatallarico.it (di solito è lo stesso che gestisce il dominio).

Se l'account email alessandra@studioannatallarico.it è stato configurato in Thunderbird dovresti poter recuperare la password anche andando in Tasto menu > Impostazioni > Password e sicurezza da qui, pulsante [Password salvate] e poi pulsante [Mostra password] (potrebbe esserti richiesta la password con cui accedi al sistema operativo)

Se invece ti riferisci alla password principale di Thunderbird, è possibile resettarla seguendo questa procedura -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/password-principale-thunderbird#w_rimuovere-la-password-principale Se resetti la password dovrai poi reinserire i dati di login degli account
creator: @next

content:
It is possible you are using 'Cards 'View' wihch means each email in list uses at least 3 lines and there are no columns.

You need to use 'Table View'. There is a new toolbar called 'Message List Header' - it's above the list of emails and it contains a 'Quick Filter' icon - look to the right of that and there is a new icon - click on it and select 'Table View'. See image below as a guide.

Then you can select and click on column headers to get the options you want.

Also Sort options can be set here: via 'Menu Bar' toolbar - View > Sort by > eg: Date, Descending, Unthreaded

If you need to see the 'Menu Bar' toolbar - I would advise you enable it because loads of things are now only available via that toolbar. Click on the 'Menu app icon' (3 lines) select 'View' > 'Toolbars' > select 'Menu Bar'
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Did you create the original HTML file using the Thunderbird Write new message window and then 'File' > Save as' > File and choose html file extension? Did you save the file to desktop or suitable location like ...My Documents/'Tbird Sig' folder? The image you include in signature - is that image also stored on computer in eg: 'My Documents/'Tbird Sig' folderfolder ?

Confirm it always looks ok when you are creating a new email to send. Does it always look like a large image in a Reply OR only sometimes or only when replying to certain people ?

When you 'Reply' - Is the content of the email you are replying to included in new reply email? Is your Reply (the text you write) above the content of reply email and is signature below your typed section OR appended at the very bottom - below everything and is there a -- separator just before the signature ?

Images of what you expect and what you are getting would help.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Are you saying the profile is on drive D? If so, after starting thunderbird, do this:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down to 'profiles' in left side and click 'about:profiles'
  3. click 'create profile' button'
  4. click next
  5. enter short name for profile, such as PROFILED and click the choose button to locate and select the profile on D.
  6. click finish and then launch

content:
Suggest you provide some useful information.

What OS are are you using? What version of Thunderbird are you using? Do you have a problem, receiving/downloading mail ? Do you have a problem sending mail ? OR do you have a problem with both receiving and sending? Is the problem account an IMAP or Pop mail account? What server are you talking about ?

In webmail account: Logon to your webmail account via a browser. Are you actually receiving new messages into the account ? If it has no new emails then Thunderbird cannot download something that does not exist. So why no new mail....please note if you have used up all the allowed quota then the account cannot receive nor send anything. Please check you current quota usage. If it's full then you would need to delete a load of emails off the server. Please note: if you have an imap account in Thunderbird then if you delete off server it means when imap folders synchronise with server the emails are auto deleted from Thunderbird because imap accounts can only display whatever is on server. In other words - in Thunderbird you need to get copies of important old mail into a suitably named folder in 'Local Folders' account before deleting them off the server.

If your quota is perfectly ok, there are new messages on server AND you use a POP account in Thunderbird: The issue may be due to a log jam - perhaps something not right with email. Empty the server 'Spam' folder In 'Inbo'x locate the oldest email not downloaded - read it and either move to another folder in webmail account OR delete and finally empty the Trash.

Then in Thunderbird - click on 'Get Messages' and it may work after that email is moved out of Inbox.

If the issue is all about error messages to do with password etc...

In Thunderbird

  • Help >Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section
  • Copy all the data and paste it into this question in forum.
  • Then tell us which account number has the problem.

Then we can compare what you are actually using when to comes to the server settings with what is required.

As you are aware server do change their requirements and as an example microsoft have done several changes and one of them is Authentication Method.

Please post image showing any error message you are seeing.

Open - Tools > Developer Tools > Error Console Clear the contents Close Error Console REstart Thunderbird When error occurs with Get Messages and/or Sending Open Error Console Post an image showing it's contents.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Per sincronizzare tutte le cartelle devi configurare la casella con IMAP. Se l'hai configurata come POP3 puoi vedere solo le cartelle standard.

Se è già configurata come IMAP, assicurati di aver selezionati per la sincronizzazione tutte le cartelle di tuo interesse -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/sincronizzazione-imap#w_configurazione-della-sincronizzazione-ed-utilizzo-dello-spazio-sul-disco (Rispetto alla guida l'interfaccia di Thunderbird è oggi un po' diversa ma la procedura è analoga)

content:
Please note there is no such thing as login to thunderbird email

I suspect you mean you have a mail account for a particular email address and it's been working for some time and suddenly it pops up saying it doesn't like password or username.

Please note - any emails sent from this support forum will go to whatever email address you set up to use and no one ever rings any telephone numbers. I would advise never to post personal information in a public forum.

Suggest you provide some useful information.

What OS are are you using? What version of Thunderbird are you using? Do you have a problem, receiving/downloading mail ? Do you have a problem sending mail ? OR do you have a problem with both receiving and sending? Is the problem account an IMAP or Pop mail account? What server are you talking about ?

In Thunderbird

  • Help >Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section
  • Copy all the data and paste it into this question in forum.
  • Then tell us which account number has the problem.

Then we can compare what you are actually using when to comes to the server settings with what is required.

As you are aware server do change their requirements and as an example microsoft have done several changes and one of them is Authentication Method.

Please post image showing the error message.

Open - Tools > Developer Tools > Error Console Clear the contents Close Error Console REstart Thunderbird When error occurs with Get Messages and/or Sending Open Error Console Post an image showing it's contents.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Verifica anzitutto che i parametri di configurazione che hai usato siano quelli suggeriti da TIM -> https://www.tim.it/assistenza/assistenza-tecnica/mail/configurazione/protocolli-posta

L'errore che ricevi secondo me può avere due cause: - quando hai configurato il server SMTP della posta in uscita non hai selezionato la casella per l'autenticazione o hai sbagliato la configurazione delle porte per cui stai provando a spedire posta senza inviare nome utente e password - Non sei abilitato all'invio tramite client. TIM pone delle limitazioni all'uso delle sue caselle email se l'indirizzo non è associato ad una linea fissa o mobile oppure se non stai usando una connessioe Tim (-> https://www.tim.it/assistenza/assistenza-tecnica/mail/configurazione/client-pc)
creator: @next

content: To my knowledge, no such tool exists - BUT, there is a way to ease the pain. If you open the junk file with a text editor such as Notepad, you can search for From: and that should stop at first line of a From address that can be copied. Pressing F3 to repeat the search will step you to next email. Continue that and you'll get through more quickly than reading each message. If put into a spreadsheet, a pivot table should find the duplicates.
creator: davidsk

content:
VERY IMPORTANT to NOT be running thunderbird doing backup. My suggested steps are

  1. exit thunderbird
  2. copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to external media

If you ever need to restore, do this:

  1. install thunderbird (if needed) and exit
  2. copy the backed up thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the existing files there.

Backups created while thunderbird is running are always corrupt and never work.
creator: davidsk
